Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in an amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinalondon1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to stay here for two nights and were amazed at this charming little hotel in the most incredible location. The rooms were re-done in a modern way but still keeping the gorgeous beams which gives it so much charm. The beds were comfy and the view was stunning. Our bathroom was clearly all new and was truly one of the most stylish I have encountered in any Paris hotel in which I've stayed. Yes the rooms are not huge but they are a good size for the location if you know anything about Paris. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “oase”
Reviews.Author: covanderhoek
Reviews.Content: in this hotel you feel completely shut of the hectic streets of paris. during the day you probably enjoy the lively environment in the "arrondissements" but back in this 5 star hotel, where it is possible to park your car inside (!) it is rewarding relaxed. it will cost you but you are assured of an outstanding stay in the very center of paris. the park in front of the hotel is great to sit and relax. and in the immediate surroundings you will find many many interesting restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The rooms are comfortable, warm ( my stay was in January) and clean. Yes, the rooms are small,but are incredibly well thought out and presented. It is a quintessentially French 'boutique' hotel, in a wonderfully central location. (note although I rated the restaurant I did not eat in it but was unable to leave it blank due to a compatability error with iPads)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyandrich
Reviews.Content: Just look at the shocking photos! Shocking! 'A luxury room'???????? - all for 150euros per night! You have got to be kidding! I work in the travel industry and truly this is a fantastic example of a breech in trading standards. I cannot be bothered to quote what the hotel advertises on the website and explain how it paints an untrue picture of what you will actually find on arrival. A shame.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: arthawkBristol
Reviews.Content: We asked for a renovated room which was very good value for money. I note that we paid approximately the same as we had in 2003. When the renovations are completed this will be quite a stylish hotel while retaining its homeliness. The drapes and heavy windows block just about all noise from the street although we have never stayed here during the heat of summer so cannot comment on whether it is noisy with the windows open. If you're looking for a traditional hotel as a base in the heart of old Paris this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: sggriffith
Reviews.Content: Beds and bedding are just what one expects in historical Paris. Unfortunately, so is the narrow spiral staircase, which caused me some alarm, but all was well. The bathroom was quite modern, more so than mine in the U.S. We did not know that breakfast was not included and were quite surprised at the price, which seemed high.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: letour11
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site, we had some trepidation, but this was quickly dispersed on arrival. Friendly staff and lovely renovated room (but small) overlooking rue de Birague, 20 metres from Place des Vosges. The rooms are small -and there is one elevator from the first floor which can take one person and one piece of luggage at a time. But if you're looking for a well-located small hotel, the price is good value. If you need space in your hotel room, this is probably not for you, but if you want to get out and enjoy the Marais, this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Charming - in it's own way”
Reviews.Author: petterpitlepytt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before we went on to the Disney park. The hotel has a fantastic location! One must take this for what it is, a small, privately run hotel. We were told that we would be on "the attic" on arrival. It turned out that the attic was a large great room with separate entrance, but had signs of being under renovation. Breakfast was eaten at the reception (!), But had relatively high quality. Fresh pastries and good coffee. All in all we were very pleased, not least because the stay was relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: mktgcove
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Hotel de la lace des Vosges already 4 times. It is a small but cosy hotel with just a few rooms. A bit old but I like it especially because of the location. In the middle of the Marais of Paris and 20 mt away from my favorite spot in Paris: La Place des Vosges. 200 mt away from St. Paul metro station. Please do not expect luxury....... still rooms are small but comfortable. Bathrooms are really tiny but got all that you need. Free internet access A bit pricy but ok Ciao

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel, ever, and the coldest reception I ever got.”
Reviews.Author: nicolnicravate
Reviews.Content: I had reserved in advance because I love the Marais area and my usual hotel was full. I arrived in the early evening after a long trip. I use a cane to walk and asked the young woman at the desk if they had an elevator, No, was the answer. I asked if they could bring my suitcase up, Yes was the curt asnwer. She proceded to tell me that my room was not in use but offered me the mezzanine. See the description on another "critique".When I saw that the bed was up 4 feet from the ground, with no ladder, I told her I couldn't handle the "ascent" and requested she found me another hotel closeby. She did and I left in a huff. My advice? Don't even think about going there unless you are an acrobat, very young or funky, or desperate.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Annabelles
Reviews.Content: Our room was small -- but comfortable and had everything we needed including a shiny new bathroom. As we travel light-ish we didn't mind carrying our bags up the stairs, and having been in Paris before, we know that you push the light switch at each landing. Not a problem. We were particularly impressed with the receptionist, Therese, who gave us great advice on navigating our way through a general strike and spent quite some time on the phone for us, rebooking our train. This hotel is not for anyone expecting the Hilton, but for intelligent travelers who'd rather spend their money on good food and seeing the sights, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was disgusting and we would not stay”
Reviews.Author: EuroptravellerFussen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a trans Atlantic flight and we disgusted. The elevator would only hold one of us with bags. The hallway was dark and worn out and we had to go through 2 doorways that belonged in a tenement to our 3rd rate room. We spent 20 minutes in our substandard room looking for another vacancy somewhere else. What a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Well...an interesting place”
Reviews.Author: richardr38
Reviews.Content: When you spend 240 Euros one night for a **** hotel in Paris and move to a ** for 95 Euros it's hard not to notice the old lamps and small laminated wood desk, the basic amenities and cramped hallways, the homey reception area and the impression no one particularly cares... it's Paris, it's relatively inexpensive, the bed is big and comfortable, and the bathroom is spacious and clean. So this is a budget hotel, well-located in the increasingly popular Marais/Bastille area.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond a joke!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MimiGil
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a friend - it was meant to be a special night in Paris. The website gave a beautiful description of a chic hotel with large rooms. We booked well in advance so should have had a good room. All I can say is that I was utterly shocked by the mezzanine room they offered me. I honestly don't think it was a proper room - it had prive written on the door and actually looked like a broom cupboard or an old fashioned garret. There was a tiny area opening on to the shower and toilet and then a tiny staircase and ladder at the side with a bed at the top - it was truly and utterly scary and even dangerous. I asked to be moved but they said the hotel was full. They really didn't understand that the rooms was not remotely acceptable to me. I was made to feel as though I was making a fuss. They have got to be joking. The rest of the hotel was apparently being renovated. My friend's room had bits of wire hanging out and the walls weren't finished - a shocker. The common parts were scary and dark with threadbare old carpets. I wouldn't believe it unless I'd seen it. I have just looked at the hotel website again and think there should be a law against misrepresentation of facts.

Reviews.Title: “What a shocker!”
Reviews.Author: Roberta1London
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that there are no photographs of the hotel on the webite, the location and some of the now surprising reviews, enticed us to book. It was terrible. Upon arrival, one assumed shabby chic was the look and feel of the hotel. However, after tripping up on the threadbare carpet and being shown a room so deviod of 'chic' and so endowed with 'shabby' we could hardly believe it... we quickly realised that we could not stay in a dirty, smoky room with cigarette burns on the wallpaper and where the access to the bath and shower was impeded by having to use the bidet as a step. Naturally, we complained and were shown the 'loft' room, located on the ground floor of an adjoining building. This was a converted classroom straight out of John Irving's 'Hotel New Hampshire' novel as the room was complete with classroom furniture from the 1950's! Avoid this hotel... While the location is luring, it is not cheap and it is definitely not worth it! We were also charged 280 Euros for the night we refused to spend there!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: SineadRyanDublin
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, after I'd booked, I was a little concerned, but was really pleasantly surprised. It was very reasonably priced, the breakfast was good value, and the location was faultless. Perhaps because I wasn't expecting much, it seemed that much better. I stayed in a quirky tiny room at the turn of the stairs - with little steps up to the bed on top of the shower room. Former Janitors closet I suspect - but it was clean and comfortable. There could have been more hot water on the last morning of our stay, but that's my only complaint. We booked three rooms, for two nights, and all four of us would stay there again. And there was free WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: arthawkBristol
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed here since 2003 and each time it has got shabbier. Now it really needs a lot of work done to spruce it up before we could be enticed back for another stay. The only thing I would say is that at 100 euros a night it compares favourably with another ordinary hotel just around the corner where we have also stayed which charges twice that. So, maybe good value if you are in Paris for one night on a limited budget and want to stay in the Marais which is a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skycolor
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently, thread bare carpeting and the place was in need of a good cleaning and paint job. 2 of the 4 staff we dealt with were OK, one other was indifferent and one outright hostile. The bar across the street doesn't even start to quiet down till 11pm. Had the breakfast once, a waste of money, they will charge you 2 euros for just a cup of coffee. Nice location, except for the bar noise and we were charged 100 euros a night, not bad for Paris. Try it, but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO - expensive, old tatty rooms, nylon sheets and not clean”
Reviews.Author: KennyGMarlow_UK
Reviews.Content: Aweful place and expensive. Good location but that is all. The room had not been decorated in 35 years and was not properly clean - loads of dust under the bed. Peeling stained wall paper, ancient bathroom, thread bare carpet, hallway half decorated but looks like it has been that way for ages. The WORST thing was the thin, cheap, nylon bed sheets that made me itch and the aweful old saggy bed. I can safely say that this is the worst hotel room I have ever stayed in except for a £30 a night B&B in Brighton which was sligthly worse. Check out the photos! We had a room at the front of the hotel on 2nd or 3rd floor in March 2009 Ken

Reviews.Title: “I lasted 30 minutes”
Reviews.Author: moswanderlust
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris many times, and this time I was passing through for just one day. I wanted to spend my time around the Place des Voges. Based on the photos and price, I knew this would be a "cheap and cheerful" kind of place. I just wanted a decent, clean room, good bed, safety and the location. The place was filthy - the lobby had torn carpets, walls covered with black marks, and a very rude receptionist. It was as if he expected me to be unhappy with the place. I am a middle-aged lady, had two pretty large suitcases covering two months of travel and the young male receptionist would not help me with my bags. He said he couldn't leave his post, but there was a lift. However, the lift was up one flight of stairs, so I had to drag my suitcases up, one at a time. The elevator was so tiny that I couldn't fit both suitcases and myself in the lift at the same time, so I had to leave one suitcase unwatched on the second level, go up to my room with one suitcase, then back down to get the next suitcase. As I got out of the elevator to pick up the second bag, all of the lights went out in the stair well. I called down the stairs to the receptionist for help, and he said the lights were on a timer on the lower level, but he wouldn't turn them on for me. It was sort of comical, but awful service. I spent about 15 minutes in the room- one towel, no place to put my suitcases. Just depressing. I went downstairs to talk to him about towels and the lousy welcome, and he had been replaced by a girl who said she didn't speak English. I told her I was leaving and the place was unacceptable, and she said "You have to pay- you used the room". We argued in my limited French and I finally made the opposite trip with the bags. I called and wrote several times after my return home, but they would not deal with me, and did charge my credit card. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more money. I wound up staying at a pretty corporate Marriott for about $75 more, but the service was fantastic and the rooms great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff but...”
Reviews.Author: bluebell25
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The hotel is very well located near the Place de Vosges & Le Marais and walking distance of many main sights, bars and restaurants. The rooms are small, even the largest of the rooms are smallish, the bathrooms in the larger rooms, however, are good sized. The newly renovated rooms are too small for a couple, and I would say suit only singles. They are nicely decorated but rooms 10/20/30/40 face the back and there was a smell of cooking prevading the room. The hotel is in a very old building, with original wooden beams which gives much character. If you want shiny & new, and therefore clean looking, this is not the place for you. The rooms and reception area were clean but some of the furniture and carpets are old and worn, a little shabby. The breakfast was fine, juice, croissants, bread and coffee. The staff are friendly. Room prices are reasonable for Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “bad surprise”
Reviews.Author: patcooke
Reviews.Content: I've read many good reviews so booked my stay in this Hotel. They sent me pictures just after I ordered, because as you can check, they don't have any picture of the rooms in their web page. Well, as soon as I arrive I already saw that the place was not really clean. Okay, I thought that maybe the room could be better, but it was so small that I cannot even put my bags there. The wall paper was "torn into pieces" dirty and the carpet either. I asked the person at the reception if the pictures that he sent me were after "Photoshop"...I've asked too if he could give us another room, he said maybe next day, but would be more expensive and upper floor with no elevator (was not working).I've told him that I had no place to put my luggages into the room, and the guy (Bart) was very rude and said that he had no idea. Well, I stayed for 4 hours trying to find a hotel, and finally I found a great place. Maybe the good reviews are about the renovated rooms...they could tell me at least about the difference between them.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: HayleyM_87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and thought that for what it was the hotel was a bit overpriced. Breakfast was 8 euro extra but we never took any. The hotel website is a bit misleading, i got the impression that the hotel had been made over but only on the surface. The building is obviously old and I appreciate that but i must admit i was expecting better in terms of the little things. We had towels with holes in them and i also noticed that the undersheet on the bed was ripped. Thankfully there is a lift on the first floor as the staircase is a bit hairy. The staff are very nice, however, and the hotel has free wireless internet access which was great. Despite the shortcomings, if i had to i would stay here again, although im sure i could get better for my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Not too awful...just not good”
Reviews.Author: zkil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in September. As the other reviews state, the rooms are small, but clean. Thankfully, we had beautiful weather, as we would not have wanted to be in that room for any length of time while awake!! Asked for a wake up call to catch a train, and never received it. When we asked why, we were told we must have done something wrong to the phone. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Place des vosges”
Reviews.Author: savanah11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in 2006 and loved it. The people at the front desk welcomed us so much that it really did feel like staying at someones home. Our room was quite small but I don't expect some huge room while in Paris. While the lift is very compact, it was just enough for our luggage (what are people looking for???). The room had crisp white linen and the most beautiful bathroom you can imagine. We enjoyed our stay so much that we are going back in three weeks and have booked this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK for us”
Reviews.Author: FelicitasBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and it was OK for us. The room was very clean -which was the most important thing for us-The bed was comfortable, very clean sheets and towels, and the shower was very good. The room was small, but we did not care about that . The hotel itself is an old building, so you have to know that this is not a "standard" hotel type and accept the experience. You have to carry the luggage by stairs up to the first floor, where there is a small elevator. The stairs are quite narrow. But if you are conscious that you are in a 17th century building, you accept the challenge and can even enyoy it -and this is the way we experienced it. The only thing that did not impress me very well was the carpets and the furniture at the entrance lobby - they seem a little bit worn -, but that did not affect us much. - This is a two star hotel anyway. The staff were corteaus at all times and we had no complaints. If you are someone who likes the Place des Vosges area in Paris, value old things and want something different from a standard impersonal hotel, we have no problems in recommending this hotel to you. Felicitas, Rodrigo and Nico (from Buenos Aires, Argentina)

Reviews.Title: “Bungled booking”
Reviews.Author: garrad
Reviews.Content: This stay did not start well. I contacted them a week before arriving to confirm accommodation and they told me they had cancelled the booking. Apparently they tried to get confirmation on my credit card and it didn't work because the card had been cancelled due to fraud. Unfortunately they didn't contact me to let me know. Anyway, the rooms were small (typical for Paris). Bathrooms were unbearably small, especially if sitting on the toilet. We only stayed one night and then they moved us on to another hotel which did not have appropriate accommodation. Luckily they found us a good hotel nearby, Hotel les Chevaliers.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Stewed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas and while out on Christmas Day our room was broken into and we were robbed of jewelry. We spent Christmas night at the local police station filling out a report. The police officer, while filling out the paperwork, warned us that Paris hotels were notorious for "stiffing" guests who were victims of crimes. The officer was so correct. The hotel never made restitution and actually accused us of having fabricated the entire story. Do Not Stay at this hotel. The owner is as dishonest as anyone we have ever encountered! A terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “charmig hotel near Bastille and Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: AurelMunich
Reviews.Content: Everytime I go to Paris, I use to stay in this hotel. Small room but everything you need. Lovely bathroom. Good location, near to Bastille and Le Marais. very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back ...”
Reviews.Author: torn8o
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't sure if this hotel would be for me or not. It was absolutely what I wanted it to be, however. This is a very old hotel in a very old part of Paris (circa 1600). But this is my favorite part of Paris, with loads of character, art, and beauty. The hotel is around the corner from Victor Hugo's house, for heaven sake. It is very European. Whoever wrote the reviews about small rooms has apparently never stayed in a traditional Paris hotel before. Lots of character in this hotel. A winding staircase around a very small elevator. Clean, small, rooms ... we felt they were soundproof at night. No trouble sleeping at all. Comfortable beds, helpful and friendly staff, great French breakfasts. I can't wait to come back. It's my new home away from home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: DrDLondon
Reviews.Content: We'd booked two nights and our reception was welcoming and friendly. Travelling with my wife and two young children, one child in bed, one in cot and me on the floor. Unbelievably cramped, some of the lights did'nt work and the ones that did flickered on and off. Paper thin walls with very little soundproofing, almost seemed that other guests were in the room with us. When complaining the following morning they wanted to charge us a cancellation fee for not staying the second night! A shame as the location is great. The words 'wing' and 'prayer' spring to mind when describing the management.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: kljwinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in May, and would not go back. The room was terrible - I was there with a friend so we had requested a room with 2 beds. We got 2 beds, but one was just a cot! I got the cot, and my back was aching after the first night. As for the tiny bathroom, the had attached a bidet to the side of the tub, so you had to step over or in it to get into the tub! Very bizzare. The carpeting was filthy, and you had to climb a very rickety staircase to get to the room, or take your chances on the the one-person elevator. The breakfast area was dark and dingy. However the most depressing aspect of this hotel was the fact that the owners keep 2 turtles in a pail in the reception area - the pail is empty except for a couple inches of water and one brick. It was so horrible coming in every day and seeing the turtles trying desperately to get out of this terribly bleak captivity. We complained to the front desk staff and they agreed that it was awful, but said the owners wouldn't do anything about it. They told us that one lovely American guest had felt so bad that he had taken the turtles for a whole day to a nearby park, so they could walk on the grass and feel the sunshine. We tried contacting the owners after our stay and offered to take the turtles to an animal sanctuary outside of Paris, but they never responded. Anyways, for the price, definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: digbyOxford
Reviews.Content: My family and myself have stayed at this hotel at least five times now and we have no complaints. If you want a bustling metropolitan hotel with every imaginable mod con at your finger tips then this hotel is probably not for you. The hotel is quaint and very old (one of the oldest in Paris) and is run by very polite staff. Every time we have stayed the hotel was clean and tidy. The lift and staircase are an experience but its like taking a historical step back in time. the location we have found is second to none with plenty of sight seeing and night life nearby Would we go back "everytime"

Reviews.Title: “It was not the Luxury Weekend Away expected”
Reviews.Author: mowbrab
Reviews.Content: We booked the 'Luxury' attic room for a week-end in June 07 at 250 euros per night. We had to climb a very tight staircase before reaching the lift on the first floor (the smallest lift I have ever seen!) the lift only went to the 4th floor and we had another staircase to climb before reaching our room. The room has a nice view across the roof tops of paris and has a wealth of old wooden beams exposed. Howevr, we had no pillowcases on the first night and the drains smelled. Not for the feint hearted, and very expensive for the general quality of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No longer our little secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kebnabi
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours recommended the Hotel de la Place des Vosges more than 10 years ago, and we've stayed there several times since. But it's getting harder and harder to get a room there, as it's becoming more well known. No longer our little secret in Paris! We enjoy it because it's not a chain, and it's in a great location, right off the old square and just a few minutes from the Bastille metro and a great restaurant area. Rooms are small, but nice; that was never our focus anyway. Breakfast is offered and it's OK, but you're really just as well off to go to the bakery nearby and pick up some fresh croissaints. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: brentwoodBrentwoodTn
Reviews.Content: this was our first time in paris. we booked des vosges for nine nights. upon arrival we were greeted outside by the hotel manager. hotel is quaint and very much like a b and b. we didnt care about the small size of the rooms, we were only in it to sleep and shower. great location with easy access to the subway. we have no complaints and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and cheating”
Reviews.Author: File101
Reviews.Content: + location, Paris and Marais itself are wonderful, but there are plenty of other hotels around. Now I know why all others were fullybooked one month advance.. - all the rest Madame, I think owner of the hotel, tried to get extra-money with all possible ways (for example without caring about confirmation, proposed loft for the last night and had to tightly negotiate to get it to the same price as triple.., As a yellow-cab -guarantee also too much from me, but with the driver I got some money back.. Paying my bill; almost 50 euros extra with her calculating..but luckily I was already alarmed myself just in this case.. and so on) Lock of the door was broken first couple of days; "nobody comes anyway.." Website of the hotel is absolutely misleading, room was ------, there was not B&O's flatscreens even at the "spacious loft" ... And so on, so on... Breakfast is in a lounge and only 3 tables... Never had a hotel experience like this and sincerely hope there's never ever going to come nothing like this in a future, for us or anybody else. Good service and nice hotel is a big part of a enjoyable holiday, although hotel is only the resting place! I was not expecting more than decent 2-stars hotel, did'nt knew there can be something like this in a world, Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Location+, design+, quiet+; but small”
Reviews.Author: cate70
Reviews.Content: Plusses: Great location; in the middle of the Marais but very quiet. Nice design. Very friendly and helpful staff. Minus: Really small room. I know it is normal in Paris, but this was really small. Will go back for short trips (3-4 days). For longer stays you need something with more space!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: kwnkillcare
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 3 occasions, over 4 years and will return. The rooms are small but adequate size. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is pefect for the visitor and the rate great value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome apartment, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I just returned from my stay in Paris at Hotel Place des Vosges, and had a great experience there. When I arrived, the person on duty said that the room my travel service had tried to book was not available, and all their rooms were taken...but, they had an apartment available next door. Normally the cost is 200 euros, but they discounted it to 150 euros, which was only slightly more than the 137 I planned to pay for a normal room. Anyway, the apartment was HUGE...almost as much sqaure footage as my house in Atlanta. Very large bedroom and living room, plus a kitchen, and a loft with some extra sleeping space (more suited for kids, but could accomodate adults as well). The whole thing looked out onto a really picturesque courtyard and was very private. True, there is construction going on in the building next door, but it is during the day when most people would be out in the city. It is also true that there are no amenities as others have commented on and the reception area is small, but I felt very accommodated and stayed in a great space. The apartment is a great option if you can get it, especially for a longer term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: London34
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking it would be charming and simple with friendly staff. I was really disappointed. The communal areas are shabby. Our room was outdated and although I wasn't expecting luxury the room was a bit depressing. The worst thing of all though is the woman who runs the hotel. She was grumpy, rude and pushy. On our last day we were told to check out by midday. We went out for some breakfast at about 10am and she insisted that we leave our key with her so that she could have the room cleaned even though we said we would be back to check out within the hour. That is just the sort of officiousness that I like to avoid when I am on holiday. I will never stay in this hotel again and I would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Moorestowners
Reviews.Content: We liked it. Yes, there is a little redecorating going on in the lobby, yes the lift isn't to all floors, and it's tiny, but to some degree, it's part of the quaint nature of an old building. We had to book a room for three, which was hard in Paris, and it was pricey (but what wasn't), but the staff were solicitous and helpful. We had one night secured and were wait-listed on the second. They helped us find another accomodation (which was also fine) and offered to try a third if we didn't like that. We felt quite comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel scams prospective guests”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I would like to inform prospective guests about Hotel de la Place des Vosges. I have had a bad experience with this particular hotel and would advise anyone to reconsider staying here. I emailed my credit card info. to the hotel in order to book a double room. The hotel, which had replied to all of my inquiries prior, never acknowledged my credit card information. Thinking perhaps the reservation staff were away, I sent subsequent emails over two days with the same non-results. I concluded by sending one final email saying that I cancelled the reservation. Again I received no acknowledgment. I sent one more email saying that I would not be responsible for any charges if the hotel went ahead and charged my credit card. Still I received no reply. In the meantime, I read a Trip Advisor review by another prospective guest who experienced the same thing as I did. Apparently the hotel has ignored other guests' cancellation emails and proceeded to charge their cards citing that they did not cancel properly via fax. But there is no specification in the hotel's emails saying that to cancel one must send a fax. It says to cancel in writing only and to that I assume that includes emails. As of today (3 weeks later) still no reply from the hotel and I just sent another email to them with no response. I tried faxing them but their phone keeps ringing. Thanks for allowing me to comment.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect little escape pad. Nestled in the heart of Paris it is just the place to relax. The rooms are small but cozy. The staff are unbeatable. They make you feel like one of the family. The lobby is a perfect place to just unwind, enjoy a cup of coffee, chat with the staff or just kick back and read a book. It is hard to believe you are only moments away from all the attractions of the city but can essentially escape back in time to a quaint little hotel in just seconds. Can't wait till we can make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful french hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful charming hotel in the center of Paris. For lovers and also positive people. Located in the Marais, the best French Art/Culture point. Xav

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was extremely comfortable and well located. reception were more than helpful. perfect location and fabulous ambience. i highly recommend this hotel to couples - maybe not children, it's pretty small.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de la Place des Vosges
HotelInfo.Address: 12 Rue de Birague | 04 Arr., 75004 Paris, France
